channel.title: version_control on Development Cheat Sheets
channel.description: Recent content in version_control on Development Cheat Sheets

item.title: git
item.description: Git is a distributed version-control system for tracking changes in source code during software development. It is designed for coordinating work among programmers, but it can be used to track changes in any set of files. Its goals include speed, data integrity, and support for distributed, non-linear workflows.

item.title: SVN
item.description:
Subversion (SVN) is an open source version control system developed as a project of the Apache Software Foundation.

TortoiseSVN is an Apache™ Subversion (SVN)® client, implemented as a Windows shell extension. It’s intuitive and easy to use, since it doesn’t require the Subversion command line client to run. And it is free to use, even in a commercial environment.
